column5: As I had a few more small jobs to complete up at the cottage last weekend, I hadn't planned on getting out on the lake to try my luck.  Most of Saturday was spent re-arranging furniture and putting together some new furniture I had purchased from IKEA....(Gotta love IKEA !!) Called it quits on Saturday evening and decided to try our luck...... .......Fished for 2 hours....NADDA !!  Sunday, we managed to get all the work done by 11 am and decided to  head out and try our luck again.   We began working a section of the north end of the lake again as this area had produced some nice fish for us.  5 Minutes after beginning......my buddy nails this little gem......Really aggressive strike as she had more than half the lure in her mouth.     We fished for another 2 hours or so and 5 minutes before we decided to call it quits, Buckster nails this nice fish very close to Big Island.......    Again, boated her, quick pic and away she went !!  So, in all.....it was a very productive weekend. Got most of the work completed and managed to get 3 to 4 hours on the water as well.  Thanks for reading,  Meely
Great Job. Seems like Pigeon produced for both of us.
Well done, got some work done and got to fish too.  Nice ski's there  Joey
how do you get any work done knowing there are nice fish like that so close by?  Thanks for report!  Cheers!
Tony....take your shirt off !!!  Good job guys.
You're on fire this year, nice fish once again!
Sounds like the Musky are really active on pigeon. Looks like you are having a great Musky season. Thanks for sharing.
Sounded like a pretty good weekend to me!  Got some work done at the cottage and then got her done on the water the next day.  Some REAL nice muskies there.  Congrats.

Looks like youse have done well with the muskies the last few weekends. I'll have to try the larger baits in deeper waters next time i'm there.  First i'll have to put the bass topwaters and spinnerbaits away.lol Nice going, ehg
Emillio !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!...Youse guys did it again!  Lisa sure taught you good...  Congrats...
Great job out there guys.  Practicing CPR (catch, photo, release) on the big ski's.WTG
it was a little to fresh!  Maybe next time lol
